FDG.function_description: E-commerce shopping with product search & categories

core_logic.logic: The app starts on the home page (page 0). Users can input a product name in the search field (S1) or click the search button (S2) to execute a search. Alternatively, they can filter products by category (e.g., All, Women, Home, S3–S7) or select a product card (S8) to view details. The bottom tab (S9) navigates to the home page, while the categories tab (S10) stays on the current page. If a search fails (e.g., slow connection), users can go back (S11) or clear the search (S12).

steps.summary: Input product name in search field
Click search execution button
Filter by 'All' category
Filter by 'Women' category
Filter by 'Home' category
Filter by 'Sports' category
Filter by 'Industrial' category
Click product card: Metal Storage Rack
Click bottom tab: Home
Click bottom tab: Categories
Click back navigation arrow
Click clear search text button
Click home category tab
Click product card: Anxiety bracelet

FDG.function_description: Displays a variety of e - commerce products (including those with deals, free shipping, and safe payment info) in the "All" category, with a search bar, category tabs, and product listings for browsing and potential purchase.

core_logic.logic: The app starts on the home page (page 0) displaying e - commerce products in the 'All' category. The user can click on the 'Men' category filter (action at [0,5]) to potentially view products specific to the Men category. Since there's only one action provided, the flow is currently a single - step interaction with the option to filter by the Men category.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Men' category filter

FDG.function_description: Displays a variety of e - commerce products (including those on lightning deals and clearance deals) under the "All" category, with features like free shipping, free returns, and secure payments, and also provides options for product search, category navigation, and access to user, cart, and home sections.
data_out: updated shopping cart (with metal storage rack added)

core_logic.logic: The app starts on the 'All' category e - commerce page, showing various products with deals, free shipping, returns, and secure payments. The user can click the 'Add to cart' button for the 'Metal Storage Rack' product. There are no branches or loops as only this single action is provided for now.

steps.summary: Click the 'Add to cart' button for the 'Metal Storage Rack' product

FDG.function_description: The "You" page in the e - commerce app is a user - centered hub. It enables users to view their credit balance, manage coupons and offers, access order details, check messages, write reviews, and utilize features such as order history, earning and freebies, address management, and following preferences, while also providing customer support and settings options.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the home page (page 0). The user clicks the 'You' bottom tab (action [0,12]), which navigates to the 'You' page (page 4). This page serves as the hub for user - centered features like credit balance, coupons, orders, etc.

steps.summary: Click the 'You' bottom tab to navigate to the 'You' page.

FDG.function_description: The Cart page in the e - commerce app displays the status of the shopping cart (currently empty), provides information about shipping and import charge policies, shows security and purchase protection badges, and in case of a network issue, offers a “Try Again” option to reload the page and potentially view recommended products.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Cart bottom tab (from page 0 to 5) to navigate to the Cart page. On the Cart page, if a network issue (e.g., 'Slow connection' message) is present, clicking 'Try Again' (implicitly part of the Cart page interaction) attempts to reload the page to view the cart status, shipping/import policies, protection badges, or recommended products. If the network is stable, the Cart page displays its content directly.

steps.summary: Click Cart bottom tab to navigate to Cart page
Click Try Again (if network issue) to reload Cart page

branches.condition: Network issue present on Cart page
No network issue on Cart page

FDG.function_description: The current page (a pop - up) displays and explains the available promotional offers of the e - commerce platform, including details about free shipping, credit for late delivery, and the 15 - day no - update refund policy.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 0. They click the promotional banner (describing shipping, credit, and refund offers) to open a pop-up (page 6) that displays detailed explanations of the e-commerce platform’s promotional offers, including free shipping, late delivery credit, and the 15-day no-update refund policy. This is a straight-line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click the promotional banner to view detailed offers

FDG.function_description: The page displays a network error message ("Oops! Slow connection") and provides a "Try Again" button to reattempt the search for "female clothes" after resolving the network issue, along with options to go back or clear the search.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the network error page (displaying 'Oops! Slow connection'). The user clicks the 'Try Again' button to reattempt the search for 'female clothes' after network issues are resolved. This action either succeeds (loading search results) or may repeat the error page if the network issue persists (implied loop on re-clicking 'Try Again' if the error remains).

steps.summary: Click 'Try Again' button to retry search after network issue

branches.condition: Network error page is still displayed (retry needed)

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a search interface where users can input an item name, order ID, or tracking number to search for related products, orders, or shipment details within the e - commerce application.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 3 and inputs a search term (e.g., product name, order ID, tracking number) into the search field. After input, the user moves to page 10, where they can either confirm the search (via the search button or a recent search tag) to view results, clear the input, or navigate back to the previous page. If confirming, the flow proceeds to page 2 (or other result pages) to display related items, orders, or shipment details.

steps.summary: Input search term (item name, order ID, or tracking number) into the search field
Click search confirmation button to execute search
Click clear search text button to remove input
Click back navigation button to return to previous page
Click recently searched tag to re-execute a past search

FDG.function_description: The current page is the e - commerce home page, which enables users to browse various products (such as the Metal Rack), view product details like prices and discounts, and add products to the shopping cart.
data_out: updated shopping cart (with metal rack added)

core_logic.logic: On the e - commerce home page, the user performs a click action on the 'Add to cart' button for the Metal Rack product. This action likely leads to a change in the shopping cart state or a confirmation page related to adding the item to the cart.

steps.summary: Click the 'Add to cart' button for the Metal Rack product

FDG.function_description: The "Your orders" page in the e - commerce app enables users to view their orders (categorized as All orders, Processing, Shipped, Delivered, Returns), and also provides options to help find orders if they are missing, like signing in with another account, using self - service order finding, or switching countries to view orders from other regions, along with handling connection - related issues.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 4. First, the user clicks the 'Your orders' navigation row (action from page 4 to 12). Then, from page 12, the user can click the back arrow to return to page 4, creating a navigational loop between these two pages for order - related navigation and backtracking.

steps.summary: Click 'Your orders' navigation row to go to page 12
Click back arrow to return to page 4

FDG.function_description: Close 'Available offers' popup button

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the page with the 'Available offers' popup. The user clicks the close button (X) on the 'Available offers' popup. This action closes the popup and navigates to the destination page (page 29). There are no branches or loops as it's a single action to close the popup.

steps.summary: Click the close (X) button on the 'Available offers' popup

FDG.function_description: Displays a network error message with a "Try Again" button to retry loading the search results for "female clothes" after a connection issue, along with navigation and cart options.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the search icon. After that, a network error page appears with a 'Try Again' button. The user can click 'Try Again' to retry loading the search results for 'female clothes', with navigation and cart options available on the error page.

steps.summary: Click the search icon (magnifying glass)

FDG.function_description: Displays a network error message ("Oops! Slow connection") and provides a "Try Again" button to retry loading the 'Women' category page in the e - commerce app after a network issue occurs.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the home page (page 7) and clicks the 'Women' category tab. If a network error occurs (displaying 'Oops! Slow connection'), the user can click the 'Try Again' button to retry loading the 'Women' category page. This process may repeat if the network issue persists.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Women' category tab
Check if network error message ('Oops! Slow connection') is displayed
Click the 'Try Again' button to retry loading the 'Women' category page

FDG.function_description: This page notifies the user of a slow network connection while attempting to load product search results for "female clothes" and provides a "Try Again" button to retry the search.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 10 and clicks a popular search tag (e.g., 'female clothes'). After this action, the app attempts to load search results but encounters a slow network, displaying a 'Slow connection' message with a 'Try Again' button. The flow then branches: if the network issue persists, the user may retry by clicking 'Try Again' (implying a loop or repeated attempt), or if resolved, results load (though the provided action focuses on the initial search and error state).

steps.summary: Click popular search tag (e.g., female clothes) to initiate search

FDG.function_description: This page provides a search interface to find specific orders by entering an item name, order ID, or tracking number within the order history section of the e - commerce app.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the 'Your orders' page (page 12). The user clicks the search orders icon, which navigates to the search interface (page 10) with a search bar for entering item name, order ID, or tracking number. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click the search orders icon on the 'Your orders' page to navigate to the search interface.

FDG.function_description: This page displays the user's processing orders (with a message indicating none are present in the current state) and provides options to troubleshoot network issues (via a "Try Again" button) or locate missing orders, within the order management section of the e - commerce app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 12 and clicks the 'Processing orders tab' to navigate to page 13. On page 13, the app displays the processing orders state (including a no-orders message) and provides options to troubleshoot network issues (via 'Try Again') or locate missing orders. The flow is a straight line to view the processing orders section.

steps.summary: Click the Processing orders tab to navigate to the processing orders page

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to locate their orders by entering a phone number (or via alternative methods like email, order ID, payment info, or switching countries) to access order details.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking 'Self - service order lookup' to enter the order - finding page. Then, a phone number is input into the designated field. Finally, the 'Find order' button is clicked to attempt to retrieve the order details. Alternatively, other methods like using email, order ID, payment info, or switching countries can be chosen at the order - finding page instead of using the phone number.

steps.summary: Click 'Self - service order lookup' to navigate to the order - finding page
Input phone number into the input field
Click 'Find order' button to search for the order

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to manage and view their order history (with tabs for different order statuses) and provides options to resolve order - finding issues or retry loading the page in case of a network problem.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the 'Your orders' page (page 12). When a network issue occurs (e.g., 'Slow connection' message), the user can click the 'Try Again' button (action_ref [12,4]) to retry loading the order history page. This action attempts to reload the page to resolve the network - related loading problem.

steps.summary: Click the 'Try Again' button to retry loading the order history page when there is a network issue.

FDG.function_description: The page displays a network connection error message ("Oops! Slow connection") and provides a "Try Again" button to attempt reloading the e - commerce product browsing page for the "Women" category after a network issue.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the page showing the 'Oops! Slow connection' message. The user clicks the 'Try Again' button to attempt reloading the 'Women' category product browsing page. There are no branches or loops as it's a single action to retry loading.

steps.summary: Click the 'Try Again' button to retry loading the page

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to locate their orders by entering a phone number (with additional options to use email address, order ID, payment information, or switch countries) to retrieve order details.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the 'Your orders' page. The user clicks the 'Can't find your order? Click here to find it' button, which navigates to the 'Find your order' page where they can enter a phone number or use alternative methods (email, order ID, payment info, or switch countries) to locate orders.

steps.summary: Click the 'Can't find your order? Click here to find it' button to navigate to the order-finding page.

FDG.function_description: The Cart page (with a slow connection state) allows users to view their shopping cart (currently empty), access shipping/import charge info, see service guarantees, and retry loading content via the "Try Again" button.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 13. The user clicks the 'Cart (No import charges)' button, navigating to page 15. On page 15 (Cart page with slow connection), the user can view the empty cart, shipping/import info, service guarantees, and has the option to retry loading via 'Try Again'.

steps.summary: Click 'Cart (No import charges)' button to navigate to Cart page

FDG.function_description: The page displays the "Processing" tab of the "Your orders" section, showing a message about no processing orders and a "Try Again" button to retry loading the page after a slow connection, along with an option to help find an order.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the 'Processing' tab of 'Your orders' with a slow connection message. The user clicks the 'Try Again' button to retry loading the page. This action likely repeats (loop) if the connection remains slow, or proceeds if the page loads successfully to show no processing orders and the help option.

steps.summary: Click the 'Try Again' button to retry loading the page due to slow connection

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to search for their orders by entering a valid email address and then clicking the "Find order" button to retrieve related order information.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 14 and clicks the 'Email address' option to navigate to page 17. On page 17, the user inputs a valid email address into the input field. Then, the user clicks the 'Find order' button to retrieve order information related to the entered email address.

steps.summary: Click 'Email address lookup option' to navigate to email input page
Input valid email address into the input field
Click 'Find order button' to retrieve order information

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to find their order by entering a valid email address and clicking the "Find order" button, as part of a self - service order lookup process.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the 'Find your order' page (page 14). The user clicks the 'Order ID lookup option' (though this seems mislabeled; likely the 'Email address' option to switch to email-based lookup), transitioning to the email entry page (page 17). On page 17, the user enters a valid email address and clicks 'Find order' to proceed with order lookup. No branches or loops are shown in the provided actions, so it's a straight flow to the email entry and submission step.

steps.summary: Click the option to switch to email-based order lookup (labeled as 'Order ID lookup option' but likely 'Email address')

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to look up their orders by entering payment - related details (such as credit card digits, order date, and exact payment amount) and then clicking the "Find order" button.
data_out: payment information form (credit card details, order date, payment amount)

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the payment info lookup option to access the payment details entry page. On this page, they can input the first 6 credit card digits, select the order date (with sub - steps to choose the day and confirm), input the exact payment amount, and then click the 'Find order' button to submit the payment information and search for the order.

steps.summary: Click payment info lookup option to navigate to payment details entry page
Input first 6 credit card digits
Click to open order date selection popup
Select order day (e.g., 05) in date popup
Confirm order date in date popup
Input exact payment amount
Click 'Find order' to submit payment info and search

FDG.function_description: The page's functionality is to prompt the user to confirm switching the shopping country to Australia (with details on account re - sign - in and changes to item availability, pricing, etc.) or to stay in the United States, and it also provides links to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the 'Switch countries option' to open the country selection context. Then, at the confirmation dialog, the user can either choose to switch to Australia (confirming the country change with account and item changes) or stay in the United States (remaining in the current country context). Links to Terms of Use and Privacy Policy are also available for review.

steps.summary: Click the 'Switch countries option' to proceed to the country selection/confirmation dialog.
Click 'Country list item (Australia)' to trigger the confirmation dialog about switching to Australia.
Input 'France' in the country/region search input (optional, for searching other countries).

FDG.function_description: The page displays an empty shopping cart, shows free shipping and no import charges policies, presents a network connection issue with a "Try Again" option, and includes a "Recommended" section (currently affected by the network issue) along with trust and service badges (e.g., safe payment, secure privacy).

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the cart page (page 15) where the shopping cart is empty, free shipping/import charge policies are shown, and trust/service badges are visible. A network issue affects the 'Recommended' section, with a 'Try Again' option. The step involves clicking the free shipping policy button (action on page 15, edge 0), and the flow remains on page 15 after this action.

steps.summary: Click the free shipping policy button

FDG.function_description: The page displays an empty shopping cart, highlights shipping/import policies, shows trust badges, and prompts to retry loading due to a network issue.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the cart page (page 15) which shows an empty cart, shipping/import policies, and trust badges. A network issue is present, prompting a 'Try Again' option. The user can click the import charges policy button (step S1) to view related details, and the flow remains on the same page after this action.

steps.summary: Click the import charges policy button

FDG.function_description: The current page provides information about why to choose the Temu app, including details on safe payment options (supported payment methods and security certifications), secure privacy practices, Temu purchase protection, and delivery guarantees.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 15. First, the user clicks the 'Safe Payment options info button' to view details (navigating to page 26). Then, the user clicks the 'Close modal button (X)' to exit the modal (navigating to page 27, a leaf step).

steps.summary: Click the Safe Payment options info button to open its details modal
Click the Close modal button (X) to exit the modal

FDG.function_description: Toggle other payment methods

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the 'Find your order' page (page 18). The user clicks the 'Other payment methods' toggle, which changes the payment method selection and navigates to page 21. This is a single-step action with no branching or looping.

steps.summary: Click the 'Other payment methods' toggle to switch payment method and navigate to page 21

FDG.function_description: The page displays Temu’s U.S. Privacy Policy, outlining how user information is collected, used, shared, and protected, along with user rights and contact information.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 26, where the 'Learn more about Secure privacy' link is clicked to navigate to page 28 (the U.S. Privacy Policy page). On page 28, the user can either click the back arrow to return, click the scroll-to-top button to jump to the top of the policy, or read the policy content. The main path is navigating to the policy, with optional actions to backtrack or scroll.

steps.summary: Click 'Learn more about Secure privacy' to open the U.S. Privacy Policy page.
Click back navigation arrow (likely to return to the previous page).
Click scroll to top button to jump to the top of the Privacy Policy page.

FDG.function_description: Privacy policy section link (What Information We Collect)

data_out: displayed privacy policy section content (What Information We Collect)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 28 and clicks the 'What Information We Collect' link in the privacy policy section. This action likely navigates to the relevant subsection (though the destination page index is null here, implying the action triggers navigation to the detailed content of that section).
